intro: Noronhia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved noronhia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, ovate leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Noronhia macrophylla is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
